title: Scarlett Moffatt tears up at cultural differences on The British Tribe Next Door
text:
Scarlett Moffatt close to tears over ‘eye-opening’ cultural differences (Picture: Channel 4)

Scarlett Moffatt was left close to tears on her new Channel 4 show The British Tribe Next Door.

The 29-year-old has travelled to Namibia along with her family, where they moved into a replica version of their home, next to the Himba tribe.

Yes, they really built a two-storey house with running water, On-Demand TV and wifi in the South African Country.

And when welcoming her new neighbours into her home, it seems she was taken aback by the locals’ reactions.

Giving a tour of the house, Scarlett witnessed a woman seeing her reflection for the first time after walking past a mirror hung by the front door.

One of her new neighbours saw her reflection for the first time (Picture: Channel 4)

She thought the glass was water at first (Picture: Channel 4)

Touching the glass, she explained to the Gogglebox star’s mum Betty, how she thought it was water at first.

The Saturday Night Takeaway star then emerged at the top of the stairs, explaining how she was close to tears at her newfound friend’s reaction.

‘I nearly cried at the top of the stairs, honestly, I can’t believe it,’ she said.

‘I think it’s just mad when I think about the number of times we check ourselves in the mirror,’ the TV personality explained before adding: ‘We wake up and do our teeth, then go and do our hair, even when we walk past a reflection we kind of look.’

Viewers shared the same reaction as Scarlett (Picture: Channel 4)

She gushed: ‘But to never know what you look like.’

And it seems viewers at home had similar reactions, as they took to Twitter in tears at the moment.

‘#thebritishtribenextdoor beautiful programme, a real privilege to share their culture and experiences. I cried so much when the lady saw her reflection for the first time,’ one wrote.

Another added: ‘Loving #thebritishtribenextdoor so far, can’t believe they have never seen their own reflections before @ScarlettMoffatt i was close to tears aswell!! Xx’

Someone else shared the same sentiment: ‘What a brilliant programme! Fascinating.! I cried when that beautiful woman saw herself in the mirror for the first time!’
